{"step_by_step_thinking": "MHC antigens, also known as major histocompatibility complex antigens, are proteins found on the surface of cells. They play a crucial role in the immune system by presenting antigens to T cells. MHC antigens are highly polymorphic, meaning they vary between individuals. However, there are certain cells in the body that do not express MHC antigens. To determine which cell type does not have MHC antigens, we can consider the function and characteristics of each cell type listed in the options.", "answer_choice": "B. Erythrocyte"}
